experience: You and Kathey both know Michael Fulcher, Raoul Encinas, and 43 others

As a start up new business owner nearly five years ago, I learned first-hand how challenging it is for small businesses to compete with national and international businesses.  The marketing investment required to attract higher volumes of new customers, is typically out of reach for most small business owners.  With my corporate background and small business experience, I believe 850zip provides the solution most local and independently owned businesses need to build customer loyalty and sustainable scale.As a community connector for 850zip:Meet with people who work, live, and play in downtown Phoenix who want to actively support local and independently owned businesses.  Reach out to local and independently owned business owners to build awareness about our program and assist in developing a unique offer that supports their business and gives their customers what they crave.Create, sponsor, and/or attend local events to build awareness and activation of our members.Negotiate strategic partnership with the community and civic leaders.Work tiredlessly for the businesses and families who call Phoenix their home.

As an Executive Business Strategist with my team of experienced consultants, provide personalized solutions to the challenges faced by business owners and executives. In today's business environment, leaders must carefully weigh their options, especially in the areas of allocating the limited resources of money, people, and time. B-ON the Obvious leads CEOs, senior leaders, and business owners through an examination of their organizations; then makes certain they have an integrated approach to processes, investment, and strategic planning to achieve important short-term gains while laying the groundwork for long-term growth. Areas of Expertise:Strategic analysis and forecastingOrganizational redesign and restructuring Executive developmentBuild business in support of living your best lifeProcess management for repeatable successSales and marketing strategiesBeginning my 25 year career with a Fortune 50 company, I've had the opportunity to serve in multiple cross-functional managerial and executive leadership positions within Operations, Sales, and Marketing. As a proven leader who consistently wins in highly-competitive environments, I'm recognized for best practices and public speaking on the National level. Our Mission:Be the best "U" in You! Our clients play-to-win and challenge the status quo. They partner with us to create positive life changing experiences and new market realities. We are not about playing it safe. We identify “round peg-square hole” solutions to advance our clients and change industries.Business Development (key offerings):Maximizing Revenue StreamsLeveraging Process ManagementEnhancing Client Sales CapacityExecutive Development & Presence (key offerings):Define Purpose and Significance Co-Develop Business Strategies and Tactics Elevate Thinking and Problem Solving
Salt Lake City Utah & Tempe, Arizona

Developed and led the agency operations strategies for the largest teams (based upon policies in force and over $250 Million in revenue) in Utah and Arizona.  Established marketing strategies and led execution of tactical plans as an internal business consultant to 40-45 agents in the Salt Lake City, Southern Utah, and the Phoenix Metroplex.

Served as one of the four core team members from over 75,000 employees to evaluate the State Farm Insurance enterprise structure and the only core team member selected to participate in the Corporate implementation and review team.  The recommendations were presented and embraced by the CEO and Chairman's Council for implementation to include restructuring the organization from 26 regional offices to 13 zones.  Upon completing the redesign project, I served as the Auto Claim Manager for over 350 claims employees in Arizona and New Mexico.

Key areas of responsibility for the three state region (AZ, NM & NV) development of marketing strategies/tactical plans, administrative oversight of agency compensation and led training and development for nearly 500 agents. Inaugural manager who led the consolidation of three independent departments while maintaining high employee engagement.Executed the strategies as an internal business consultant to 32 agents in the Greater Las Vegas market with primary responsibilities to increase revenue per agency and maximize sales capacity.

Mary Wakeford
Author
May 9, 2013, Mary reported directly to Kathey

Many of Kathey’s recommendations will come from her peers and executive level business associates spanning her decades of association with a Fortune 50 company.  They will endorse her highly for her intellect, leadership, analytical superiority, and her ability to view and assess business solutions from 36K feet.   Her business acumen is as good as it gets.  My endorsement will lend to Kathey’s management style from someone who did not work as her peer or superior, but rather from an executive support role.  Enterprise Structure Study was launched in January 2000, and was my first opportunity to work directly with Kathey, providing support for the core team. I was immediately impressed with her down to earth and inclusive nature.  The study was a self-contained, independent and highly confidential company overview, involving virtual teams, excessive travel, and demanding effective communication and team accessibility from across the country with the teams.  Kathey aced the assignment.I laud Kathey’s humanity, her down to earth accessibility; intuition; intelligence; her willingness to do whatever task needed to perpetuate the good of the whole.   Kathey is one of those rare managers that will literally be in the trenches getting it done, alongside every level of hire, with an intense loyalty to her team and employees.  She possesses the rare ability to infuse humor and her depth of life experiences to motivate, inspire and teach.  Kathey possesses a level of generosity that is unmatched, as evidenced by her volunteerism to various charity boards and causes.  Mary Wakeford

My experience working side by side with Kathey can best be described as one of the more influential peer relationships in my professional career, and all positive.  I gained tremendous respect for Kathey's approaches to problem solving, managing multiple groups and tasks across both on-site and virtual platforms.  I cannot think of a single task or project that was completed with anything less than 100% effort, and equally impressive results.  Many people experience "life" and learn as they go, but few truly harvest experiences from life and convert those lessons into making the world a better place.  Kathy represents the few and that is what makes her a good friend as well as the consummate professional.
